meanings.definition: Divide into smaller parts or sections.
meanings.sent1: I will subdivide the cake into equal slices for everyone.
meanings.sent2: The builder plans to subdivide the land into smaller lots for housing.
meanings.sent3: Trying to subdivide a single grape into tiny pieces is quite a challenge!
meanings.sent4: Her mind seemed to subdivide into different compartments when under stress.
meanings.sent5: The artist's brushstrokes subdivide the canvas into a beautiful mosaic of colors.

meanings.definition: To divide something into smaller parts or sections.
meanings.sent1: They decided to subdivide the project into manageable tasks for each team member.
meanings.sent2: The chef will subdivide the recipe into clear steps for the cooking class.
meanings.sent3: It's like trying to subdivide a giant sandwich into bite-sized pieces!
meanings.sent4: The melody seemed to subdivide the air, filling the room with music.
meanings.sent5: Her laughter seemed to subdivide the tension in the room, bringing relief to all.
